radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed tomography (CT) of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple small gas bubbles in the mediastinum (consistent with pneumomediastinum), decreased intraabdominal and intrapelvic fat, opacities suggestive of stool throughout the colon.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the pituitary gland
Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the abdomen and liver
radiographic_examinations.findings: Higher signal intensity in the liver than in the spleen, no evidence of masses, iron overload, ascites, or lymphadenopathy.
Subcutaneous emphysema of the visualized lower portion of the neck, soft-tissue air deep to the right clavicle, and a small amount of pneumomediastinum parallel to the trachea.

Extensive pneumomediastinum and associated subcutaneous emphysema, bilateral patchy ground-glass opacities without air bronchograms, diffuse bilateral bronchial-wall thickening, and a thin-walled cyst or bulla in the right lower lobe.
A cystic mass adjacent to the gallbladder, incompletely characterized.
T2-weighted hyperintense mass in the liver adjacent to and inseparable from the gallbladder, with no enhancement on T1-weighted imaging.
